element.name: Medications Permitted by the State
element.definition: A list of all of the medications permitted by the state to be used by each EMS state certification/licensure level.
element.v3Comment:
This data element should capture all of the medications permitted by the state for any/all levels of EMS personnel in the state. This should be stored as an RxNorm (RXCUI) Code. This is associated with the EMS Agency State (dAgency.01).
The EMS agency should submit "Not Applicable" and "Nil" to the state system for the demographic export. The state EMS system does not need to import this information into their database. It is the responsibility of the state to submit this element to the national EMS database (NEMSIS). Reference the Demographic Dataset Submission Guide for further details.
element.v3Changes:
State EMS systems which have regulatory authority to identify medications to be administered within the state may identify specific RxNorm codes based on medical direction and their own need.
List of medications based on RxNorm (RXCUI) code.
Reference the NEMSIS Suggested Lists at: https://nemsis.org/technical-resources/version-3/version-3-resources/

asserts.assert: When Medications Permitted by the State has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When Medications Permitted by the State is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
When Medications Permitted by the State has a Not Value, no other value should be recorded.
